membership:
The City of Milan has signed the "Milan Urban Food Policy Pact" for the creation of an international network of cities in order to share a common policy on food and make its food system more equitable and sustainable. 
Here you can find the website: 
http://www.foodpolicymilano.org/urban-food-policy-pact/ 
 
It is also part of the Eurocities network set up by the major European cities with the aim of sharing common challenges and opportunities at local governance level. 
Here you can find the website: 
http://www.eurocities.eu/eurocities/home
goals__remit:
The Municipality of Milan is a Local Authority and is responsible for the strategic planning and delivery of a large number of services for the city (education, social services, economic development, mobility, housing). 
Second largest city in Italy (1.400.000 inhabitants in its Municipality, 180 sqKm), Milan is also administrative and business centre in the largest Italian metropolitan area, with a population of about 5.000.000 people, and the main city of Lombardy, Italian more populated and rich region. Milan Municipality is the local goverment of the core city. 
It is an international city, a crossroads of economic, financial and cultural exchanges, in particular innovation. 
It is an European metropolis that has signed a series of agreements, twinning and collaboration protocols around the world; it is the home of the most important Italian non-governmental organizations working in the field of international cooperation, as well as hosting the Italian headquarters of the major international economic groups. It promotes European and international cooperation and relations with the local institutions of other countries through joint initiatives of mutual interest. 
Its international projects take place in synergy and in coherence with the other programs and activities of the Administration, enhancing the city's actors and the city's active instances on priority thematic areas. 
The City of Milan has also joined the Milan Urban Food Policy Pact, which is the first international pact between the Mayors on urban food policy and is one of the most important legacy of Expo 2015. 
The City of Milan has the power to sign Collaboration Agreements with other international cities in the areas of common interest.  
The areas of collaboration are tourism, culture, education, training, architecture, trade, technology, urban and social development, university research and the exchange of good public administration practices.
